lead_paragraph: Mr. Warmbier, an undergraduate at the University of Virginia who tried to steal a propaganda poster, was convicted of subversion.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: North Korea Gives U.S. Student a 15-Year Sentence
headline.main: North Korea Sentences Otto Warmbier, U.S. Student, to 15 Years’ Labor

snippet: Mr. Warmbier, an undergraduate at the University of Virginia who tried to steal a propaganda poster, was convicted of subversion.
abstract: American college student Otto F Warmbier is sentenced to 15 years of prison and hard labor in North Korea for trying to steal political propaganda poster from hotel in Pyongyang; Obama administration condemns sentence, which comes even as tensions  have been rising over North's nuclear weapons and missile programs.
